channel.title: Getting my website popular?
channel.description:
What ways (that do not cost me) would you recommend I do to get my website popular and active? I've got this image on a friend of mine's blog: [[img]http://img256.imageshack.us/img256/68/bannerxh.png[/img]
But what else would you recommend I do to get it active?

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

The Reaper, yeah, I barely know any Python, and know no Ruby or Perl. I intend to let the members discuss that, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

The best advantage you can have is to have experience with the field you’re working in. For example, if you were to establish a community for RS you should have a few years of experience in order to discuss and provide anything you’re knowledge is capable of. As for what you’re doing, it’s sort of difficult to provide anything, because I’m assuming you don’t know say, Python Pearl and Ruby as much as you know Java and HTML.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Just a tip, work on editing the look of the theme, that will also help give your website a unique look. That’s the first thing i look for in a website, is what is unique about it, typically, the first thing if im looking at that, would be the theme.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

People seem to think it takes a short time to get a website that has a lot of frequent visitors. Make people come to your website, and keep adding things so more people will come and the current will stay.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

You need to offer something original or useful that your competitors don’t have.

Why join your programming community, when there are more established and active forums with professionals and faster responses? Sadly for you, most people wouldn’t want to join your site. There’s always a few “internet friends” that will join, but you won’t get the masses of people to join just by advertising.

You seem to be doing well so far though. Getting a few hundred members is hard for most people.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

TabbyKiller, please stay on topic.

Read full topic

your picture is advertising your website.

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

You said to post on Youtube videos. If someone posted a link on my video that had nothing to do with the video, I’d see it as spam.

Read full topic

item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:4, topic:350907”]I don’t want to spam advertise, though, I want people to like my website.[/quote]posting often and spam are different things.

item.title: Getting my website popular?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

put links on your sig on many forums, and post often; along with advertising where possible e.g. youtube comments.

Read full topic
